travelperkAdvancedSettings.contentText: In this section, you can customize the data you want to include in your {{brandName}} expenses created from your TravelPerk invoices.
travelperkAdvancedSettings.categoryMappingSubLabel: Expense entries from TravelPerk invoices in {{brandName}} are categorized according to the booking type. Map the listed booking types to your desired categories in {{brandName}} for accurate expense coding.
travelperkAdvancedSettings.defaultValuesSubLabel: Default values below will act as substitutes for missing TravelPerk data points. For instance, if a user or category is inactive, the values below will be used instead of the unavailable user/category.
travelperkAdvancedSettings.defaultEmployeeSubLabel: Depending on your payment profile settings, the integration will create expenses on behalf of the respective employee. If the employee is not found in {{brandName}}, the expenses will be created on behalf of the admin who set up the integration.
travelperkAdvancedSettings.defaultCategorySubLabel: If an invoice includes multiple booking types or if any of the mapped categories are disabled in {{brandName}}, the category configured here will be used.

travelperkPaymentProfileSettings.contentText: Each invoice in TravelPerk is linked to multiple user roles such as booker, traveler and card holder. You can create expenses for all your TravelPerk invoices in {{brandName}} based on the user role you configure for each payment profile.
travelperkPaymentProfileSettings.assignUserRoleLabel: Assign user role for required payment profiles

netsuiteExportSettings.exportReimbursableExpensesDescription: Enable this to export the reimbursable expenses from {{brandName}}. If not enabled, any out-of-pocket expenses will not be exported to NetSuite.
netsuiteExportSettings.howExpensesExported: How should the expenses be exported?
netsuiteExportSettings.chooseTransactionType: Choose the type of transaction in NetSuite to export your {{brandName}} expenses

netsuiteExportSettings.vendorPayablesAccountDescription: Post all your reimbursable expenses to a default vendor payables account.

netsuiteExportSettings.expenseExportState: At which state should the expenses be ready to export from {{brandName}}?

netsuiteExportSettings.howShouldExpensesBeGrouped: How should the expenses be grouped?

netsuiteExportSettings.postCCCExpensesToEmployeePayable: Post all your company corporate card transactions to a default employee payables account.
netsuiteExportSettings.postCCCExpensesToDefaultCCC: Post all your company corporate card transactions to a default credit card account.
netsuiteExportSettings.defaultCCCVendorDescription: Post your company corporate card transactions to a default credit card vendor when a match is not found in NetSuite and auto creation is switched off.

intacctImportSettings.syncingDataDimensions: Syncing data dimensions from Sage Intacct
intacctImportSettings.importSettingsError: Error saving import settings, please try again later
intacctImportSettings.description: In this section, you can choose the fields required to be imported from Sage Intacct to {{brandName}}.
intacctImportSettings.importDimensionsDescription: The Sage Intacct dimensions listed below will be mapped to their corresponding {{brandName}} Field as shown below. Importing these dimensions from Sage Intacct to {{brandName}} will make the values available as a dropdown in the expense form for your employees to choose from.
intacctImportSettings.defaultMappingNote: This is a default mapping and you will not be able to modify it.
intacctImportSettings.importTooltip: Importing a dimension syncs active values from Sage Intacct every 24 hours. Deactivated values in Sage will also be disabled in {{brandName}}
intacctImportSettings.mapDimensionsDescription: The Sage Intacct dimensions listed below can be mapped to an existing {{brandName}} field of your preference, or a new custom field. Importing these dimensions from Sage Intacct to {{brandName}} will make the values available as a dropdown in the expense form for your employees to choose from.
intacctImportSettings.selectiveDataNote: If you'd like to use only selective data from Sage Intacct, map a Sage Intacct dimension to a field in {{brandName}} and turn off the import, as importing the data will sync in all the active values in Sage Intacct. You can add the required values in {{brandName}} and map them later in the integration mapping section.
intacctImportSettings.uniqueSageIntacctFieldsError: Sage Intacct fields should be unique
intacctImportSettings.importDependentFieldsLabel: Import cost code and/or cost type from Sage Intacct as dependent fields
intacctImportSettings.uniqueFieldsError: *{{brandName}} and Sage Intacct fields should be unique.
intacctImportSettings.configureImportMethodDescription: You have the option to import either just the names of your values or both names and code, based on how your employees identify these values.
intacctImportSettings.oneTimeSetupNote: This is a one-time setup and cannot be modified once the values are imported to {{brandName}}.
intacctImportSettings.howToImportSubLabel: You have the option to import either just the names of your {{field}} or both the names and codes.
intacctImportSettings.selectImportMethodError: Please select how the {{field}} should be imported
intacctImportSettings.duplicateFieldNameError: Oops! It looks like another field with the same name already exists in your {{brandName}} account. Would you please give the field a different name?
intacctImportSettings.label: Label
intacctImportSettings.dependentFieldWarningCostCodes: You have imported cost codes from Sage Intacct by mapping them to fields in {{brandName}}. By turning off the import, you would lose the mappings you've established for these fields.
intacctImportSettings.dependentFieldWarningCostCodesAndTypes: You have imported cost codes and cost types from Sage Intacct by mapping them to fields in {{brandName}}. By turning off the import, you would lose the mappings you've established for these fields.
intacctImportSettings.continueConfirmation: Are you sure you want to continue?

sage50OnboardingLanding.headerText: A quick guide to help you set up your Sage 50 integration.

sage50OnboardingPrerequisites.configurationSubHeaderText: To get started, add a few files from Sage 50. This will help set up your integration quickly and accurately.
sage50OnboardingPrerequisites.configurationHeaderInfoTooltip: Importing your full Chart of accounts and Vendor lists ensures a smooth setup. No data will be added to {{brandName}} until you confirm.
sage50OnboardingPrerequisites.chartOfAccountsSublabel: This helps set up your integration and is required for all exports.
sage50OnboardingPrerequisites.vendorSublabel: Needed for certain export types. If you only use General journal entry, you can skip this for now.

sage50ExportSettings.contentText: Configure how and when expenses from {{brandName}} can be exported to Sage 50.
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableExportTypeSubLabel: Select the type of transaction you want to create in Sage 50 when exporting expenses.
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableDefaultCreditLineAccountSubL: Select the Sage 50 account to be credited for expenses sent as journal entries.
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableDefaultAccountPayableAccount: Select the accounts payable account where invoices should be posted.
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableExpenseStateSubLabel: Choose whether to export expenses after the reimbursement is initiated (Processing) or after the reimbursement is settled (Closed).
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableExpenseGroupSubLabel: Choose whether to export each expense as an individual record (Expense) or group all expenses in a report into one record with line items (Expense Report).
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableExportDateDisabledText: Change grouping method to use different date
sage50ExportSettings.reimbursableExportDateSubLabel: Expenses will be posted in Sage 50 with the {{selectedDateOption}} from {{brandName}}. This is automatically set based on your grouping selection.
sage50ExportSettings.cccExportTypeSubLabel: Select the type of transaction you want to create in Sage 50 when exporting expenses.
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultCreditLineAccountSubLabel: Select the Sage 50 account to be credited for expenses sent as journal entries.
sage50ExportSettings.cccExpenseStateSubLabel: Select when corporate card expenses should be exported from {{brandName}}: after they are approved (Approved) or after they are closed (Closed).
sage50ExportSettings.cccExportGroupSubLabel: Choose whether to export each expense as an individual record (Expense) or group all expenses in a report into one record with line items (Expense Report).
sage50ExportSettings.cccExportDateSubLabel: Expenses will be posted in Sage 50 with the {{selectedDateOption}} from {{brandName}}. This is automatically set based on your grouping selection.
sage50ExportSettings.cccExportDateDisabledText: Change grouping method to use different date
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultAccountPayableAccountSubLabel: Select the accounts payable account where invoices should be posted.
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultVendorSubLabel: Select a fallback vendor for expenses where the merchant in {{brandName}} doesn't match any vendor in Sage 50. All unmatched expenses will be posted to this vendor.
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultCashAccountSubLabel: Select the cash account to use when an expense isn't matched to a card transaction.
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultPaymentMethodSubLabel: Enter the payment method to use for creating corporate card expenses in Sage 50 (e.g., Check, Credit card).
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultPaymentMethodInputHint: Use the exact payment method name as it appears in your Sage 50 settings.
sage50ExportSettings.exportSettingsSaveError: Error saving export settings, please try again later
sage50ExportSettings.cccDefaultVendorInfoTooltip: We recommend using a value like "Unknown Vendor" for unmatched merchants.

sage50ImportSettings.vendorSubLabel: Import vendors as merchants to capture supplier details, and simplify reconciliation.
sage50ImportSettings.jobSubLabel: Import job codes as projects to enable accurate job costing and simplify billable invoicing.
sage50ImportSettings.phaseSubLabel: Import phases to allocate expenses stage-wise across jobs.
sage50ImportSettings.costCodeSubLabel: Import cost codes to classify expense types within each job or phase.
